hints.label: def-hybrid-gauge-structure
hints.title: Hybrid Gauge Structure
hints.content:
29: :label: def-hybrid-gauge-structure
30: 
31: The Fractal Set gauge group is the product:
32: 
33: $$
34: G_{\text{total}} = S_N \times_{\text{semi}} (\text{SU}(2)_{\text{weak}} \times U(1)_{\text{fitness}})
35: $$
36: 
37: where:
38: 
39: **1. S_N Permutation Gauge Symmetry** (fundamental, discrete):
40: - **Origin**: Walker labels $\{1, \ldots, N\}$ are arbitrary bookkeeping indices
41: - **Gauge transformation**: $\sigma \cdot \mathcal{S} = (w_{\sigma(1)}, \ldots, w_{\sigma(N)})$ for $\sigma \in S_N$
42: - **Connection**: Braid holonomy $\text{Hol}(\gamma) = \rho([\gamma]) \in S_N$ for closed loops $\gamma$
43: - **Wilson loops**: Gauge-invariant observables from braid topology
44: 
45: **2. SU(2)_weak Local Gauge Symmetry** (emergent, continuous):
46: - **Origin**: Cloning interaction creates weak isospin doublet structure
47: - **Hilbert space**: $\mathcal{H}_{\text{int}}(i,j) = \mathcal{H}_{\text{iso}} \otimes \mathcal{H}_{\text{div}} = \mathbb{C}^2 \otimes \mathbb{C}^{N-1}$
48: - **Gauge transformation**: Acts on isospin factor only
49: - **Physical invariant**: Total interaction probability (see §1.3)
50: 
51: **3. U(1)_fitness Global Symmetry** (emergent, continuous):
52: - **Origin**: Absolute fitness scale is unphysical; only relative fitness matters
53: - **Global transformation**: $\psi_{ik}^{(\text{div})} \to e^{i\alpha} \psi_{ik}^{(\text{div})}$ (same $\alpha$ for all)
54: - **Physical invariant**: $|K_{\text{eff}}(i,j)|^2$ (cloning kernel modulus squared)
55: - **Conserved charge**: Fitness current $J_{\text{fitness}}^\mu$ (Noether's theorem)
56: 
57: **Hierarchy:**
58: - **S_N is fundamental**: Present from first principles (walker indistinguishability)
59: - **SU(2) is local but emergent**: Arises from cloning doublet structure
60: - **U(1) is global and emergent**: Consequence of fitness potential structure
hints.raw_directive:
26: From {prf:ref}`thm-sn-su2-lattice-qft` in {doc}`13_fractal_set/00_full_set.md`, the Fractal Set realizes a **hybrid gauge theory** with three symmetry layers.
27: 
28: :::{prf:definition} Hybrid Gauge Structure
29: :label: def-hybrid-gauge-structure
30: 
31: The Fractal Set gauge group is the product:
32: 
33: $$
34: G_{\text{total}} = S_N \times_{\text{semi}} (\text{SU}(2)_{\text{weak}} \times U(1)_{\text{fitness}})
35: $$
36: 
37: where:
38: 
39: **1. S_N Permutation Gauge Symmetry** (fundamental, discrete):
40: - **Origin**: Walker labels $\{1, \ldots, N\}$ are arbitrary bookkeeping indices
41: - **Gauge transformation**: $\sigma \cdot \mathcal{S} = (w_{\sigma(1)}, \ldots, w_{\sigma(N)})$ for $\sigma \in S_N$
42: - **Connection**: Braid holonomy $\text{Hol}(\gamma) = \rho([\gamma]) \in S_N$ for closed loops $\gamma$
43: - **Wilson loops**: Gauge-invariant observables from braid topology
44: 
45: **2. SU(2)_weak Local Gauge Symmetry** (emergent, continuous):
46: - **Origin**: Cloning interaction creates weak isospin doublet structure
47: - **Hilbert space**: $\mathcal{H}_{\text{int}}(i,j) = \mathcal{H}_{\text{iso}} \otimes \mathcal{H}_{\text{div}} = \mathbb{C}^2 \otimes \mathbb{C}^{N-1}$
48: - **Gauge transformation**: Acts on isospin factor only
49: - **Physical invariant**: Total interaction probability (see §1.3)
50: 
51: **3. U(1)_fitness Global Symmetry** (emergent, continuous):
52: - **Origin**: Absolute fitness scale is unphysical; only relative fitness matters
53: - **Global transformation**: $\psi_{ik}^{(\text{div})} \to e^{i\alpha} \psi_{ik}^{(\text{div})}$ (same $\alpha$ for all)
54: - **Physical invariant**: $|K_{\text{eff}}(i,j)|^2$ (cloning kernel modulus squared)
55: - **Conserved charge**: Fitness current $J_{\text{fitness}}^\mu$ (Noether's theorem)
56: 
57: **Hierarchy:**
58: - **S_N is fundamental**: Present from first principles (walker indistinguishability)
59: - **SU(2) is local but emergent**: Arises from cloning doublet structure
60: - **U(1) is global and emergent**: Consequence of fitness potential structure
61:

hints.label: def-dressed-walker-state
hints.title: Dressed Walker State and Interaction Hilbert Space
hints.content:
68: :label: def-dressed-walker-state
69: 
70: Following {prf:ref}`thm-su2-interaction-symmetry` in {doc}`13_fractal_set/00_full_set.md`, the quantum state of the cloning interaction involves a tensor product structure.
71: 
72: **1. Diversity Hilbert Space:**
73: 
74: For walker $i$, the **diversity Hilbert space** is:
75: 
76: $$
77: \mathcal{H}_{\text{div}} = \mathbb{C}^{N-1}
78: $$
79: 
80: with orthonormal basis $\{|k\rangle : k \in A_t \setminus \{i\}\}$ labeling diversity companions.
81: 
82: **2. Dressed Walker State:**
83: 
84: Walker $i$ is "dressed" by superposition over all possible diversity companions:
85: 
86: $$
87: |\psi_i\rangle := \sum_{k \in A_t \setminus \{i\}} \psi_{ik}^{(\text{div})} |k\rangle \in \mathcal{H}_{\text{div}}
88: $$
89: 
90: where:
91: 
92: $$
93: \psi_{ik}^{(\text{div})} = \sqrt{P_{\text{comp}}^{(\text{div})}(k|i)} \cdot e^{i\theta_{ik}^{(\text{div})}}
94: $$
95: 
96: with:
97: - $P_{\text{comp}}^{(\text{div})}(k|i) = \frac{\exp(-d_{\text{alg}}^2(i,k)/(2\epsilon_d^2))}{\sum_{k'} \exp(-d_{\text{alg}}^2(i,k')/(2\epsilon_d^2))}$: diversity companion probability
98: - $\theta_{ik}^{(\text{div})} = -d_{\text{alg}}^2(i,k)/(2\epsilon_d^2 \hbar_{\text{eff}})$: U(1) phase from algorithmic distance
99: 
100: **Physical interpretation**: $|\psi_i\rangle$ encodes how walker $i$ perceives its diversity environment.
101: 
102: **3. Isospin Hilbert Space:**
103: 
104: The **weak isospin space** is:
105: 
106: $$
107: \mathcal{H}_{\text{iso}} = \mathbb{C}^2
108: $$
109: 
110: with basis:
111: - $|↑\rangle = (1, 0)^T$: "cloner" role
112: - $|↓\rangle = (0, 1)^T$: "target" role
113: 
114: **4. Interaction Hilbert Space (Tensor Product):**
115: 
116: The full interaction space for pair $(i,j)$ is:
117: 
118: $$
119: \mathcal{H}_{\text{int}}(i,j) = \mathcal{H}_{\text{iso}} \otimes \mathcal{H}_{\text{div}} = \mathbb{C}^2 \otimes \mathbb{C}^{N-1}
120: $$
121: 
122: **5. Weak Isospin Doublet State:**
123: 
124: The state of the interacting pair is:
125: 
126: $$
127: |\Psi_{ij}\rangle = |↑\rangle \otimes |\psi_i\rangle + |↓\rangle \otimes |\psi_j\rangle \in \mathbb{C}^2 \otimes \mathbb{C}^{N-1}
128: $$
129: 
130: **Explicit form:**
131: 
132: $$
133: |\Psi_{ij}\rangle = \sum_{k \in A_t} \left(\psi_{ik}^{(\text{div})} |↑, k\rangle + \psi_{jk}^{(\text{div})} |↓, k\rangle\right)
134: $$
135: 
136: where $|↑, k\rangle = |↑\rangle \otimes |k\rangle$.
137: 
138: **Critical distinction**:
139: - $|\Psi_{ij}\rangle$: Full interaction state in $\mathbb{C}^2 \otimes \mathbb{C}^{N-1}$ (dimension $2(N-1)$)
hints.raw_directive:
65: ### 1.2. Dressed Walker States and Tensor Product Structure
66: 
67: :::{prf:definition} Dressed Walker State and Interaction Hilbert Space
68: :label: def-dressed-walker-state
69: 
70: Following {prf:ref}`thm-su2-interaction-symmetry` in {doc}`13_fractal_set/00_full_set.md`, the quantum state of the cloning interaction involves a tensor product structure.
71: 
72: **1. Diversity Hilbert Space:**
73: 
74: For walker $i$, the **diversity Hilbert space** is:
75: 
76: $$
77: \mathcal{H}_{\text{div}} = \mathbb{C}^{N-1}
78: $$
79: 
80: with orthonormal basis $\{|k\rangle : k \in A_t \setminus \{i\}\}$ labeling diversity companions.
81: 
82: **2. Dressed Walker State:**
83: 
84: Walker $i$ is "dressed" by superposition over all possible diversity companions:
85: 
86: $$
87: |\psi_i\rangle := \sum_{k \in A_t \setminus \{i\}} \psi_{ik}^{(\text{div})} |k\rangle \in \mathcal{H}_{\text{div}}
88: $$
89: 
90: where:
91: 
92: $$
93: \psi_{ik}^{(\text{div})} = \sqrt{P_{\text{comp}}^{(\text{div})}(k|i)} \cdot e^{i\theta_{ik}^{(\text{div})}}
94: $$
95: 
96: with:
97: - $P_{\text{comp}}^{(\text{div})}(k|i) = \frac{\exp(-d_{\text{alg}}^2(i,k)/(2\epsilon_d^2))}{\sum_{k'} \exp(-d_{\text{alg}}^2(i,k')/(2\epsilon_d^2))}$: diversity companion probability
98: - $\theta_{ik}^{(\text{div})} = -d_{\text{alg}}^2(i,k)/(2\epsilon_d^2 \hbar_{\text{eff}})$: U(1) phase from algorithmic distance
99: 
100: **Physical interpretation**: $|\psi_i\rangle$ encodes how walker $i$ perceives its diversity environment.
101: 
102: **3. Isospin Hilbert Space:**
103: 
104: The **weak isospin space** is:
105: 
106: $$
107: \mathcal{H}_{\text{iso}} = \mathbb{C}^2
108: $$
109: 
110: with basis:
111: - $|↑\rangle = (1, 0)^T$: "cloner" role
112: - $|↓\rangle = (0, 1)^T$: "target" role
113: 
114: **4. Interaction Hilbert Space (Tensor Product):**
115: 
116: The full interaction space for pair $(i,j)$ is:
117: 
118: $$
119: \mathcal{H}_{\text{int}}(i,j) = \mathcal{H}_{\text{iso}} \otimes \mathcal{H}_{\text{div}} = \mathbb{C}^2 \otimes \mathbb{C}^{N-1}
120: $$
121: 
122: **5. Weak Isospin Doublet State:**
123: 
124: The state of the interacting pair is:
125: 
126: $$
127: |\Psi_{ij}\rangle = |↑\rangle \otimes |\psi_i\rangle + |↓\rangle \otimes |\psi_j\rangle \in \mathbb{C}^2 \otimes \mathbb{C}^{N-1}
128: $$
129: 
130: **Explicit form:**
131: 
132: $$
133: |\Psi_{ij}\rangle = \sum_{k \in A_t} \left(\psi_{ik}^{(\text{div})} |↑, k\rangle + \psi_{jk}^{(\text{div})} |↓, k\rangle\right)
134: $$
135: 
136: where $|↑, k\rangle = |↑\rangle \otimes |k\rangle$.
137: 
138: **Critical distinction**:
139: - $|\Psi_{ij}\rangle$: Full interaction state in $\mathbb{C}^2 \otimes \mathbb{C}^{N-1}$ (dimension $2(N-1)$)
140: - $|\psi_i\rangle$: Dressed walker state in $\mathbb{C}^{N-1}$ (dimension $N-1$)

hints.label: def-su2-transformation
hints.title: SU(2) Transformation on Interaction State
hints.content:
145: :label: def-su2-transformation
146: 
147: An SU(2) gauge transformation acts on the isospin factor only:
148: 
149: $$
150: |\Psi_{ij}\rangle \mapsto |\Psi'_{ij}\rangle = (U \otimes I_{\text{div}}) |\Psi_{ij}\rangle
151: $$
152: 
153: where $U \in \text{SU}(2)$ acts on $\mathcal{H}_{\text{iso}} = \mathbb{C}^2$ and $I_{\text{div}}$ is the identity on $\mathcal{H}_{\text{div}}$.
154: 
155: **Matrix form for $U = \begin{pmatrix} a & b \\ -b^* & a^* \end{pmatrix}$ with $|a|^2 + |b|^2 = 1$:**
156: 
157: $$
158: |↑\rangle \otimes |\psi_i\rangle + |↓\rangle \otimes |\psi_j\rangle \to (a|↑\rangle + b|↓\rangle) \otimes |\psi_i\rangle + (-b^*|↑\rangle + a^*|↓\rangle) \otimes |\psi_j\rangle
159: $$
160: 
161: $$
162: = |↑\rangle \otimes (a|\psi_i\rangle - b^*|\psi_j\rangle) + |↓\rangle \otimes (b|\psi_i\rangle + a^*|\psi_j\rangle)
163: $$
hints.raw_directive:
142: :::
143: 
144: :::{prf:definition} SU(2) Transformation on Interaction State
145: :label: def-su2-transformation
146: 
147: An SU(2) gauge transformation acts on the isospin factor only:
148: 
149: $$
150: |\Psi_{ij}\rangle \mapsto |\Psi'_{ij}\rangle = (U \otimes I_{\text{div}}) |\Psi_{ij}\rangle
151: $$
152: 
153: where $U \in \text{SU}(2)$ acts on $\mathcal{H}_{\text{iso}} = \mathbb{C}^2$ and $I_{\text{div}}$ is the identity on $\mathcal{H}_{\text{div}}$.
154: 
155: **Matrix form for $U = \begin{pmatrix} a & b \\ -b^* & a^* \end{pmatrix}$ with $|a|^2 + |b|^2 = 1$:**
156: 
157: $$
158: |↑\rangle \otimes |\psi_i\rangle + |↓\rangle \otimes |\psi_j\rangle \to (a|↑\rangle + b|↓\rangle) \otimes |\psi_i\rangle + (-b^*|↑\rangle + a^*|↓\rangle) \otimes |\psi_j\rangle
159: $$
160: 
161: $$
162: = |↑\rangle \otimes (a|\psi_i\rangle - b^*|\psi_j\rangle) + |↓\rangle \otimes (b|\psi_i\rangle + a^*|\psi_j\rangle)
163: $$
164:

hints.label: def-fitness-operator
hints.title: Fitness Operator on Diversity Space
hints.content:
171: :label: def-fitness-operator
172: 
173: From {prf:ref}`def-fitness-operator` in {doc}`13_fractal_set/00_full_set.md`, the **fitness operator** for walker $i$ acts on $\mathcal{H}_{\text{div}}$ as:
174: 
175: $$
176: \hat{V}_{\text{fit},i} |k\rangle := V_{\text{fit}}(i|k) |k\rangle
177: $$
178: 
179: This is diagonal in the companion basis.
180: 
181: **Expectation value** for dressed walker $|\psi_i\rangle$:
182: 
183: $$
184: \langle \psi_i | \hat{V}_{\text{fit},i} | \psi_i \rangle = \sum_{k \in A_t} \left|\psi_{ik}^{(\text{div})}\right|^2 V_{\text{fit}}(i|k)
185: $$
186: 
187: **Cloning score operator** on $\mathcal{H}_{\text{int}} = \mathcal{H}_{\text{iso}} \otimes \mathcal{H}_{\text{div}}$:
188: 
189: Define isospin projectors $\hat{P}_{\uparrow} = |↑\rangle\langle↑|$ and $\hat{P}_{\downarrow} = |↓\rangle\langle↓|$.
190: 
191: The **cloning score operator** is:
192: 
193: $$
194: \hat{S}_{ij} := (\hat{P}_{\uparrow} \otimes \hat{V}_{\text{fit},i}) - (\hat{P}_{\downarrow} \otimes \hat{V}_{\text{fit},j})
195: $$
196: 
197: **Expected score:**
198: 
199: $$
hints.raw_directive:
168: ### 1.3. Gauge-Invariant Physical Observables
169: 
170: :::{prf:definition} Fitness Operator on Diversity Space
171: :label: def-fitness-operator
172: 
173: From {prf:ref}`def-fitness-operator` in {doc}`13_fractal_set/00_full_set.md`, the **fitness operator** for walker $i$ acts on $\mathcal{H}_{\text{div}}$ as:
174: 
175: $$
176: \hat{V}_{\text{fit},i} |k\rangle := V_{\text{fit}}(i|k) |k\rangle
177: $$
178: 
179: This is diagonal in the companion basis.
180: 
181: **Expectation value** for dressed walker $|\psi_i\rangle$:
182: 
183: $$
184: \langle \psi_i | \hat{V}_{\text{fit},i} | \psi_i \rangle = \sum_{k \in A_t} \left|\psi_{ik}^{(\text{div})}\right|^2 V_{\text{fit}}(i|k)
185: $$
186: 
187: **Cloning score operator** on $\mathcal{H}_{\text{int}} = \mathcal{H}_{\text{iso}} \otimes \mathcal{H}_{\text{div}}$:
188: 
189: Define isospin projectors $\hat{P}_{\uparrow} = |↑\rangle\langle↑|$ and $\hat{P}_{\downarrow} = |↓\rangle\langle↓|$.
190: 
191: The **cloning score operator** is:
192: 
193: $$
194: \hat{S}_{ij} := (\hat{P}_{\uparrow} \otimes \hat{V}_{\text{fit},i}) - (\hat{P}_{\downarrow} \otimes \hat{V}_{\text{fit},j})
195: $$
196: 
197: **Expected score:**
198: 
199: $$
200: \langle \Psi_{ij} | \hat{S}_{ij} | \Psi_{ij} \rangle = \langle \psi_i | \hat{V}_{\text{fit},i} | \psi_i \rangle - \langle \psi_j | \hat{V}_{\text{fit},j} | \psi_j \rangle

hints.label: prop-su2-invariance
hints.title: SU(2) Invariance of Total Interaction Probability
hints.content:
205: :label: prop-su2-invariance
206: 
207: From {prf:ref}`prop-su2-invariance` in {doc}`13_fractal_set/00_full_set.md`, the SU(2) gauge-invariant observable is the **total interaction probability**:
208: 
209: $$
210: P_{\text{total}}(i, j) := P_{\text{clone}}(i \to j) + P_{\text{clone}}(j \to i)
211: $$
212: 
213: **Invariance statement:**
214: 
215: $$
216: P_{\text{total}}(i, j) = P'_{\text{total}}(i, j)
217: $$
218: 
219: where primed quantities are computed from the rotated state $|\Psi'_{ij}\rangle = (U \otimes I_{\text{div}})|\Psi_{ij}\rangle$.
220: 
221: **Physical interpretation**: An SU(2) rotation changes the "viewpoint" of the interaction (which walker is cloner vs target), but the **total propensity for the pair to interact** is gauge-invariant.
hints.raw_directive:
202: :::
203: 
204: :::{prf:proposition} SU(2) Invariance of Total Interaction Probability
205: :label: prop-su2-invariance
206: 
207: From {prf:ref}`prop-su2-invariance` in {doc}`13_fractal_set/00_full_set.md`, the SU(2) gauge-invariant observable is the **total interaction probability**:
208: 
209: $$
210: P_{\text{total}}(i, j) := P_{\text{clone}}(i \to j) + P_{\text{clone}}(j \to i)
211: $$
212: 
213: **Invariance statement:**
214: 
215: $$
216: P_{\text{total}}(i, j) = P'_{\text{total}}(i, j)
217: $$
218: 
219: where primed quantities are computed from the rotated state $|\Psi'_{ij}\rangle = (U \otimes I_{\text{div}})|\Psi_{ij}\rangle$.
220: 
221: **Physical interpretation**: An SU(2) rotation changes the "viewpoint" of the interaction (which walker is cloner vs target), but the **total propensity for the pair to interact** is gauge-invariant.
222:
